name: snowplow
content:
snowplow noun
(VEHICLE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C ] a vehicle or device for removing snow from roads or railroads: A snowplow clearing a street can block a driveway. A team of 56 snowplows continues to chip away to widen lanes in Cleveland.
Stephen Oliver/Dorling KINDERSLEY/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesHow does the guy who drives the snowplow get to work in the mornings?Snowplows had been pulled off the roads in western Iowa because of deteriorating conditions.

snowplow noun
(SKIING)
[ C usually singular ] in skiing, a simple way of turning or stopping in which the points of the skis are turned toward each other: The snowplow is a beginning skiing technique. To a novice the snowplow turn is the start of real downhill skiing.
Brian Summers/First Light/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesIn a snowplow on gentler slopes both skis can be tilted up on their edges.Most beginner skiers master the snowplow turn on a beginner slope.

snowplow verb
(SKIING)
[ I or T ] in skiing, to turn or stop with the points of the skis turned toward each other: We had practised, endlessly, snowplowing to control our speed. I was amazed to see my daughter snowplowing her way through a sort of obstacle course.

snowplow verb
(REMOVE PROBLEMS)
[ T ] to remove or deal with problems for a child, so they never have to do anything difficult or never fail, and do not learn how to do things for themselves: Are you snowplowing your kid? By snowplowing all opposition and doing everything for them, they may be robbing their children of confidence and self-reliance.
